column4: Greetings from Dublin. I've looked through a lot of posts here and there, about getting my dvd playback working, but I'm not getting anywhere.  The problem is that as soon as I put the dvd in the drive, the system mounts it as a CD-Rom.  I've tried doing symbolic links and all that, but to no avail.  Anybody want to try and help?
The error xine gives is "the source can't be read."
you need libdvdcss
no not really, just plain xine if you can, or totem - xine
that is both strange and dangerouse
ahh, but i cannot forsake my love of expresso
sorry
i am trying though
USA pacific coast
and i will, trust me, and at un down i will play my pipes also
whatever it started with is what would be best, it no doubt has already detected your dvd player
try setting it to /cdrom
do you only have one cd/dvd drive or do you have two?
i suggest that, unless you are having bugs or problems, that you not upgrade...
i have all of those also and mine works
so you have reinstalled libdvdcss2?
and totem - xine?
ok try that
so do you have just regular xine installed?
if so, then try installing totem - gstreamer
I uninstalled libdvdcss2.  But now I have to go looking to reactivate the relevant repository.
it shouldn't be much harder than just installing it again
taht could have been the problem there, synaptic needs all the sources of all the programs it has in order to build and upgrade dependancies
yup, well i am clear out of ideas... i am kind of new to linux so....
